column1: sozialhelden/wheelmap-android,open,Usage of outdated location,[],"This is a follow-up of [sozialhelden/wheelmap/#648](https://github.com/sozialhelden/wheelmap/issues/648) and following threads in the German OSM Forum:
* [Warum wheelmap.org in München einfach so sauviel ""Spaß"" macht!](https://forum.openstreetmap.org/viewtopic.php?id=60363)
The OpenStreetMap community still observes new POIs being added at wrong locations and is going to lose patience.

I assume that the bug is located in [`org.wheelmap.android.manager.MyLocationManager.calcBestLastKnownLocation()`](https://github.com/sozialhelden/wheelmap-android/blob/master/app/src/main/java/org/wheelmap/android/manager/MyLocationManager.java#L219). This method is called by the constructor of the `MyLocationManager` class.

As a first step, the code retrieves the last known location from the network and GPS provider using the Android system library. If both fails, the method returns `null`. The constructor is already able to handle `null` properly.

If one of the two retrieved locations is null, the other one is returned even if it is old. That's one reason of the bug. If both locations are not null, the age of the GPS location is checked. If it is less than 5 minutes old, it will be returned.

The [next line](https://github.com/sozialhelden/wheelmap-android/blob/master/app/src/main/java/org/wheelmap/android/manager/MyLocationManager.java#L234) contains the second part of the bug. It returns `true` if the GPS location is older than the network location. The comparison operator is `<` but it should be `>=` or `>` because Location.getTime() returns the time in seconds since 1970-01-01.
There are two possible fixes: A simple hack and a better solution.
The simple hack would only use the GPS as source of location and harm user experience where GPS is difficult to use (cities with high buildings, indoor etc.). The method would look like this:

The second solution would require to check the status of the location everywhere in the app where the location is used for anything else than just centering the map view. Following changes are necessary:
2. Check the validity of the location everywhere where it is necessary."

this repeats many times in layouts. its not DRY. To refactor as own widget.
sozialhelden/wheelmap-android,closed,category unknown, type unknown in POI detail view",[],"- I got to a detail view of a POI (example: ""Tresor Club"") and look at the rows ""category"" and ""type""
- I expect to see a category name (""leisure"") and type name (""nightclub"")
- Instead, I see ""Category Unknown"" and ""Type Unknown"" although this information is available on wheelmap.org ( http://wheelmap.org/nodes/612418460 )
This seems to be the case for all POIs.

sozialhelden/wheelmap-android,open,MapActivity, google version, clean sources",[],"The first versions of the app were running with google maps. We are using Mapsforge now, but still there are files related with google maps stored in project's sources (layout, java ...).
sozialhelden/wheelmap-android,closed,Search,[],We wont support the search in the first version.
Just remove icons and calls from the UI.
This has to be discussed who the search can work, on the server, locally ... ?
sozialhelden/wheelmap-android,open,POIDetailActivity,[],A lot of POIs have incomplete data sets (missing address, phones, websites, etc.)
Its better to show just defined fields( hide empty).
In the POIDetailActivityEditable of course all has to be visible

sozialhelden/wheelmap-android,open,POIDetailActivityEditable form,[],Now we have 2 edit fields for Category and Category-Type (as combox). The iOS app has one List where type entries are grouped together for every category. It makes the user input easier.
To implement this way also in android client.
sozialhelden/wheelmap-android,closed,Category Icons, ListActivity",[],"Icons are 16x16 pixel big, better to say 16x16 pixels small for the ListActivityView.
We need bigger icons for ListActivity.
There are more ways how to do that:
- just store bigger asset and downscale it in runtime

sozialhelden/wheelmap-android,open,Category Icons, MapActivity",[],"The server delivers through the API icons for categories. Icons don't change too much in the time, so maybe its better to have them as assets already delivered with the app, to save the startup up time.
sozialhelden/wheelmap-android,open,ListActivity, options menu",[],"Depending on a selected item in the ListActivity should actions possible (edit, delete, ...)

sozialhelden/wheelmap-android,open,Online map render as fallback for MapActivity,[],I case the App has been installed on the phone and started for the first times, there are no offline maps. They have to be downloaded and the curent map has to be selected. This is not the best user experience, so an fallback to the online maps is good solution.
MapForge enables this, we should it test if it works, so a user can work seamlessly without offline maps.

After user enters MapActivity, we can suggest to the user to download offline maps and navigate him directly to the MapDownloadActivity. This suggestion Dialog/Activity should have checkbox for do not show again, to not disturbe users they want to use online maps.
sozialhelden/wheelmap-android,open,ListActivity as default,[],The ListActivity is the default view. After the App starts, the ListActivity is the default Activity.
sozialhelden/wheelmap-android,closed,ApiKeyManager,[],- default developer API_KEY if not logged in, no editing, only wheelchair state
- User+password request for getting API:KEY form server
- every action which requier to be logged chcecks th estate and if th euser is not logged in, comms LoginActivity

sozialhelden/wheelmap-android,closed,Edit location on MapActivity,[],There in the iOS App can a user change the location of the POI by moving it with finger on the map. We have to check, if it is possible also with MapForge.

sozialhelden/wheelmap-android,closed,Preferencies settings, wheelchair",[],"Settings for wheelchair state is now as RadioBox. Normally we can display more or all types. So we need to change radiobox into checkbox.

sozialhelden/wheelmap-android,closed,Offline Map Download Section (perhaps) needs a way to cancel download,[],This is something for feature paradize. Likely needs a rewrite of MapFileService. Task-Management and interruption of tasks needs to be improved.
